discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Explanation: ebook p.58, Adding new items to the Security Incidetn Catalog requires the sn_si.admin role.

questions.question_text: What roles are required to modify Security Incident Catalog items?
When designing the Security Incident Catalog what should happen to all catalog items?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
Explanation: ebook p.17, "what catalog items needs to stay/go/change? what will the catalog look like? who uses it? how will users be trained on its use?"

choices.D: All catalog items should be renamed to suit the language for that customer, so users know which to pick.
choices.B: All catalog items should be designed specifically to that customer's agreed needs.
choices.C: All catalog items should be removed. They're just examples, and must be replaced by different ones specific to that customer.
choices.A: All catalog items should be displayed. These represent incidents common to all businesses.

questions.question_text: Select all of the following which are the target personas for MITRE ATT&CK 2.0? (Choose three.)

choices.B: Rollup additional records information to Major Security Incident
choices.C: Rollup additional records information to Data Loss Prevention Incidents
choices.D: Rollup additional records information to imported Security Incidents
choices.A: Rollup Data Loss Prevention records to Major Security Incident
